author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: The overall level of care we received was very good
body:
I am just in with my son for a check-up after we were discharged last week. They have fully discharged us after everything has come back clear. The overall level of care we received in Daisy Hill was very good, from being in Accident and Emergency, Daisy Ward, and now here in PAW.  
The staff are lovely, I recognise a few from when we were admitted. They made a big impact on my son as he did not mind coming back in as he wanted to see the really nice staff again.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: The staff seem very friendly
body:
I am not going to lie, I am very nervous since I do not know what to expect. It is my son's first time here after getting referred. I hope it will all be okay, they reassured me on the phone that it would not be a stressful thing to do on my son, so that eased my tension a little.  
The staff seem very friendly. I've seen them interacting with another child, and they were so pleasant and happy. My son cannot wait to meet them after he saw them.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: The level of care is outstanding
body:
My daughter has been here quite often, as she gets her asthma checked. We come every 3-6 months to ensure she is on the right inhaler. I am glad of this, as they have all of her records so know if she is improving, staying the same or getting worse. They were able to tell me that she gets worse in the winter with the colder weather and told me what to expect. The level of care is outstanding they only give out the best care.  
The staff I have interacted with so far are excellent, they know her and my daughter does not mind coming here, which helps. They make it fun by doing games such as the peak flow test they say who can blow the highest. The staff explain all to me and ensure I know everything I need to know and allow me to ask questions if I have any.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: I definitely do not have any complaints about it.
body:
I am only in for my baby's 1 month check-up. I hope everything is okay. I just said to reception I was here and they were very friendly. I just hate when they prick her foot, it stresses me out, although I know it needs to be done. I am glad this check-up is done, as it just makes sure everything is going good and my baby is healthy.  
The staff seem so pleasant and friendly. My experience here overall, even having the baby, was very good. I definitely do not have any complaints about it.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

title: Terrible Service and charges are extortionate
body: I did an e consultation, waited over 2 weeks for someone to contact me, they agreed action needed to be taken but this surgery was unable to perform this very simple procedure, so I asked for a private referral letter to save the NHS costs , they are now asking for £25 for a one line referral letter - I am now having to waste valuable hospital resources  as I do not agree with this unfair charge - so again well done Middleton for being the worst and most unequipped doctors surgery  - the surgery is getting worse as time goes on

author: gammazq76
title: wouldn’t get my shopping
body:
This morning on the ward I was told that I could not get things from the patients shop until Monday. I started to speak to a female qualified about it. The other male qualified started to shout at me telling me-you are not getting it till Monday-he said this 2 times. I told him that I was going to talk to the female qualified about it. He then said it again. I said to him-im not talking to you-I did use a swear word.  
He went on to say that he would put me in Seclusion, I told him to do it. A regular HCA jumped up rubbing his hands smiling on his face saying Yes.  
This was all sorted when the female qualified took me away from the situation and then I went off ward to do interviews.

author: Camila
title: The staff immediately put me at ease
body:
The staff were amazing at the clinic. I had been very worried about going to the clinic, and about getting any difficult news. I was also concerned about the scans they were going to do.  
The staff immediately put me at ease. Dr Bhat, the consultant, took time to take my history, and explained all the procedures before getting my OK to go ahead.  
The nurses introduced themselves and took time to ensure I was comfortable to go ahead. The doctor and/or nurses told me before each test what they were going to do and asked me at each stage if I was OK, and did I want to continue.  
They checked my pain levels to make sure I was always good. After the examinations/scans they again made sure I was safe and well to leave. They were professional, kind and thoughtful at all stages of the visit.  
I felt well looked after by the professional staff, the news of my available results was delivered with care and concern.

author: Rikqs54
title: Someone's on my side
body: Thank you so much for today Lucy! I really do appreciate the support, I wouldn't have been able to suggest a medication increase or to talk as well as I did, sometimes all I need is to know someone's on my side advocating for me and only wants the best for me.

author: BP274
title: Staff at the clinic couldn't have been any better
body:
I underwent colonoscopy at Ninewells Hospital, Endoscopy Suite (Vanguard Endoscopy). Staff at the clinic couldn't have been any better; right from the minute I checked in I was met with helpful, kind nurses/specialist nurses/doctors.  
I wouldn't necessary volunteer to do it again (for obvious reasons) but would say to anyone who is due to undergo this procedure: Please do not worry about a thing, you will be in good hands and the procedure itself was no problem at all. I must say though that I did opt for sedation and would do that again, I felt calm but was still fully aware of everything going on around me.  
Unfortunately, the STAR awards nominations are now closed, because as far as I am aware, every member of staff deserves this.

author: Bionica
title: My hip replacement
body:
I recently had hip replacement surgery at Western Isles hospital in Stornoway.  
I sincerely wish to thank the departments and staff involved- pre op and pre admission clinics, surgical ward staff, the theatre team, physiotherapists and Occupational Therapy. It was naturally an anxious time but the excellent advice and reassurance helped me along. The clinics, procedure, the aftercare and my very good recovery was seamless, incredibly painless and easy. Thank you again so so much.

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff have all been working very hard
body: I was admitted via ED. I arrived at a good time, as there wasn’t that many people waiting, so they saw me very quickly. Everything was fine here. Not long after, a porter brought me onto the ward. I’m staying in a bay with three others so I don’t have much privacy, and it can get very noisy and chaotic at times, which makes it hard to rest. The ward has good facilities and they're all cleaned well. The ward is very busy and it can get a bit cluttered at times as there’s a lot going on. The staff have all been working very hard, they're amazing.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The cleaners always make sure to clean my room very well
body: The staff on this ward have been great, the communication with the nurses and doctors has been good, I feel comfortable asking any questions and I feel as if I am being listened to. This ward is spotless, the cleaners always make sure to clean my room very well, and the facilities are also cleaned well. The food has been okay, the menu is similar every day and after a while the food becomes sickening.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: soilbd39
title: Excellent patient service by Health Records
body:
I would like to thank Helen who works within the Health Records and Referral Management team at the Queen Elizabeth University Hospital, Glasgow. She went over and above her normal work to help me.  
My 18year old son had been referred to the RAH, Paisley Gastro team by our local doctor. I chatted to Helen to make sure our doctor had marked the referral as urgent (which he hadn't and that had to be rectified by me chasing!) I explained my son was starting University in a few weeks but as he was feeling so poorly-he didn't think he would manage the start date. She was very kind and really listened to me showing real compassion and empathy. She then offered to find out what stage my son's referral was at. Within 30mins she called me back to advise an IBD specialist nurse was happy to have a telephone consultation with my son and myself 2 days later  
Helen, you are simply wonderful, and I can't thank you enough for the kindness you showed me. My son is now being helped and University doesn't seem insurmountable. He is awaiting a colonoscopy within the next 10days.  
I hope this thank you reaches you and your manager, Dean, appreciates what a fabulous member of staff he has.

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff are all treating me really well
body: I arrived to the hospital earlier this week in an ambulance. It arrived quickly and the staff were just brilliant, as soon as I was brought into ED I was seen by a doctor. After a few hours I was given a bed on the ward, everything on the ward has been fine so far, the staff are all treating me really well, and I enjoy being in their company. The ward has a good layout and I feel as if I have enough room, the toilets and showers are also very close to my room so it is very easy to access them.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I always feel as if I am being listened to
body: The staff on this ward have been nothing but good to me, the level of care I have been receiving has been great, I always feel as if I am being listened to and they are always happy to answer any questions I have for them. The beds on the ward are very comfortable and I feel as if I have lots of room. The food has been nice enough, I really enjoy the ice cream they have for desserts, sometimes they even give me extra.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: augustshx
title: The whole team were brilliant
body:
Attended as a day case for my surgery. It is the second time I have had the Stracathro experience, and as before the whole team were brilliant - from ward nurses (Karen and Iona), healthcare assistants, nurse practitioners (June), theatre and recovery team, anaesthetist Mike and surgeon Prof Smith. Everyone was so friendly, attentive and reassuring.  
Thanks again for all your outstanding care.

author: HandyLady
title: All of the staff were absolutely amazing
body:
I had carpal tunnel surgery at Cannock Chase Hospital. All of the staff were absolutely amazing. I was kept informed at every stage of the process. Even though I was the last patient there (due to my blood pressure being high), they stayed with me and did all they could.  
I felt great, despite recovering from my hand op.

author: melonge33
title: Constructive feedback
body:
I attended a nurse led surgical wound review appointment this afternoon at my local hospital and was treated extremely well by kind and caring nurses in a hospital where I had once worked.  
They had asked if I would place an entry into the Care Opinion website and I was happy to do so.  
The questionnaire that invited comment which I found impossible to follow: I therefore attempted to phone the 0800 number provided on line but after waiting 10 mins when nobody answered I gave up.  
Heaven knows how much this initiative (Care Opinion) will have cost but, from my experience, it has been money wasted. Such money might have better been spent in order to provide car parking to meet the needs of the hospital outpatients.  
As meaningful commentary on the process of review: my notice of the appointment provided no information as to what care would be provided: the excellent nurses were expecting to remove 6 stitches placed 11 days ago - that is way too long to wait and is at variance with the advice given by my surgical team on the day of my minor procedure. My wife removed the stitches on day 5 using a stitch cutter that we bought from Amazon.  
One final comment: my local general practice is 10 mins away and there’s ample parking: the hospital is 45 mins away and there is no parking. Of course, all wounds are very different but in my case the review might as easily been undertaken by the general practice based nurses: I accept this might not be so for all such wounds.  
I hope this message is not regarded a rant but, rather, an attempt to offer meaningful feedback as might yet improve a standard of care which has already proved to be near perfect.  
Of course you may include my feedback but may it be understood that I was delighted with the way I was treated.  
Thanks.

author: kilgourd02
title: Every one of them is worth their weight in gold
body: Went for a colonoscopy today and was helped with multiple female nurse/doctors, and every one of them made me feel so comfortable during the start to end of the procedure. Every one of them is worth their weight in gold, and more so thankful to them for today! Thank you so much, Wishaw General Hospital, means the world to me.

author: MacCal
title: Radiography: from bad to worse
body:
I accompanied my mum, who’s in her 80s and has dementia and limited mobility, for an x-ray in the Minor Injuries Unit today. The x-ray was straightforward enough but we were then asked to wait in a waiting room before someone discussed the x-rays with us.  
The unit was obviously busy but, after waiting for an hour, I decided to ask if there was a problem. It turned out the radiographer had assumed my mum was a minor injuries patient, when she had been referred by her GP, and she shouldn’t have been asked to wait as the results will be passed to her GP. Another radiographer then turned up to explain the results of the x-ray, which they proceeded to do in front of a full waiting room. I complained that there was no privacy and they then found a side room, but insisted on stating that they weren't divulging any sensitive information.  
Me and my mother found the whole experience unnecessarily time-consuming, frustrating and the way in which my mum was dealt with was unprofessional. I hope she does not need to go back, but I will be challenging staff about arrangements if she does.

author: Lochwinnoch
title: Mixed experience in hospital
body:
Treated for dog bite on my arm at 4.45pm. Reception staff warned me wait for treatment could be hours, answered my questions, were professional, lovely. Wait was only 90 mins. People who came in after me were seen before me because their injuries were more serious, as is only right. The nurse I saw was wonderful — efficient, quickly cleaned my wound, gave me Tetanus injection, antibiotics, dressings for next few days. Told me what to look for over next 72 hours. Asked me if I had questions, which is excellent. All of these steps will seem routine and obvious to most, but I must stress how great it is to have efficient treatment, with empathy, eye contact and clear communication. How did I feel? Hugely, sincerely grateful to all the staff — thank you. Deeply sympathetic at the underfunding, under-resourcing of the NHS. If anyone’s listening, please pay them more.  
By contrast, a 95-year-old man was sitting in a wheelchair in pyjamas and dressing gown, with bare feet, just inside the main door. After 30 mins his daughter arrived and tried to find out where his taxi was. She had to go to the intercom at the clinical access door and say all this — everyone waiting heard all the details. A nurse came out and phoned to chase up the taxi. They’d been told it would be there in two minutes, but 30 minutes later it wasn’t. If it was due in two minutes, could someone not have stayed with him till it arrived? If his daughter had not been able to be there, what would have happened? Should someone not check on patient pickups, at least for vulnerable patients?

author: frostyt76
title: I could not fault any of the team
body: From start to finish, the staff and doctor was brilliant at VHK Kirkcaldy. They made me feel at ease and explained every step of the way what was happening. I could not fault any of the team. Well done, NHS Fife.

author: omegakw53
title: Booking an appointment
body:
I tried for almost 2 months to book an appointment, being on hold for up to an hour on the phone each time. Every time I finally got through, I was told there were no appointments and to ring back the next week.  
I rang back every time they told me to, and was told every time that there were no appointments. I only needed my contraceptive implant removing, which had expired. I was told they were not currently able to offer this service and to contact my GP. My GP told me they didn’t remove implants and to contact Cobridge. It was a vicious cycle.  
When I finally got through, I was offered a phone consultation that day. I took an early lunch break from work so I could receive the call, but wasn’t contacted until 90 minutes after my appointment time. No apology or anything.  
I now finally have an appointment, but it has not been an easy experience at all. The lady I finally spoke with during my phone consultation was amazing, it’s a shame everything else was so awkward to deal with.

author: Baby slothy🦥🦥
title: Kind staff
body: I have got a sore hip and everyone has been very kind to me and my mum. They made us a cup of tea ☕️.

author: carrollr02
title: The procedure was carried out with excellent precision, care & professionalism
body:
I received wonderful treatment in the Dermatology Department at SWAH when I had to have a growth removed from my face. I was in recovery from a recent cancer diagnosis and was dreading yet another procedure. The staff who were down from Altnagelvin, Marie and Leah, were amazing at putting me at ease and taking an interest in my story.  
The procedure was carried out with excellent precision, care & professionalism. The lumpy growth turned out to be cancerous, but it has healed brilliantly with hardly a mark.  
My utmost thanks to Dr Podmore & staff for their kindness & care.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: FedUpWaiting!
title: Long wait in A & E
body: As a regular it came as no surprise that the A+E wait time at FVRH to be seen was excruciatingly prolonged. Why is this always the case at FVRH? I know of many people who have made complaints about this issue but yet its still ongoing?

author: DDEE
title: We are forever thankful
body:
My son was taken ill in January, 2022. He was 18 at the time he was suffering with pins and needles in his hands and feet. He collapsed and was taken to hospital, as first he was diagnosed with a vitamin deficiency, but he continued to get worse. He was losing weight rapidly, just under 3 stone in a month.  
After numerous tests he was diagnosed with Guillian-Barre Syndrome. This was a shock to all involved.Whilst in Wishaw Hospital he received IVIg transfusions which we thought was the start of his slow recovery.  
After being discharged we started to get in the community physio from Coathill Hospital. This was an absolute godsend. The girls that came to our house were fantastic, one in particular. When my son seemed to be getting weaker she noticed this straight away, and within the hour we were back in hospital.  
More transfusions and a further 2-week stay in Wishaw. The staff were attentive and amazing. Once home, the physio commenced, which was fantastic, the relationship, the empathy and compassion they had was exactly what we needed.  
We have been told his condition can take months to go away, but he is making great progress. He has to learn to walk again, he is on crutches at the moment, taking steady steps.  
We have had one horrific year, but we are beginning to see the light. Without the community physio I don’t know where we would be today.I wanted to share our story as a family and thank the NHS. It’s not just about the hospitals, it’s also about the local GP, the community nurses, physios, even the ambulance transport guys.  
We are forever thankful. Words cannot describe what you have done for our son. THANK YOU.

author: Nettie85
title: Great care in the Children's hospital
body:
Our child was poorly for a long time, losing weight and becoming very ill, quick referral from the doctors to RACH for tests and kept in after a diagnosis of severe Crohn’s disease.  
Every single person from the day ward, anaesthetist, nurses, whole GI team, pain nurse, play specialist have gone above and beyond every single time we were and are in for treatment. We’re in every six weeks for infusions and in between for bloods and with an autistic, anxious child, everyone goes out their way to make our child feel comfortable and at ease. Thank you, very lucky to have the nhs and such amazing workers

author: Mazzy
title: Excellent care in ophthamology
body:
I had orbital decompression surgery last September which was performed by Dr. Cauchi and Dr. Gillam. I now require further surgery on my eyelids.  
I have the utmost respect and gratitude towards Dr. Cauchi the nurses, and clerical staff in opthalmology. They are all so lovely, kind and caring.  
What can I say about Dr. Cauchi? He is a truly amazing consultant and brilliant surgeon. I cannot thank him enough ( he made me feel normal after the surgery as my eyes were popping out of their sockets!!) Sometimes we are too quick to complain and too slow to compliment.

author: JCD
title: My daughter
body:
I can’t thank the ICATT team enough!  
Wow what an amazing, dedicated and skillful service.  
My young person has Autism and PDA. We have had, what feels like, every service involved over the years. There’s been some good examples of practice amongst the negative experiences. However, the negative examples have been terrible!  
As a family, we haven’t been listened to, have been spoken to and spoken down to, not believed, blamed and ignored. We have had such conflicting advise that it becomes confusing. It’s been a terrible journey that has not only damaged our young person, but has effected siblings and a marriage.  
We have got used to services being involved for short term interventions and then closed without further support. In fact at times, it’s been so traumatic and stressful - we’d rather not ask for help as it’s been so patchy.  
However, there was a referral made which got refused but passed onto the ICATT team and things started to look up!  
The team are incredibly skillful and knowledgeable. We now feel, after 6 gruelling years of being in crisis, actually hopeful….  
That is an incredible feeling.  
Our trust has been placed in this service and they haven’t faulted. They listen without judgement, they support and have taken the stress away.  
We can’t thank you enough!

author: LisaMcA
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: The whole experience was very positive
body:
Story by daughter of 80+ year old male patient from Derry/Londonderry area  
My 95 year old father was very reluctant to go back to hospital so the care team treating him at home was a godsend. The team were friendly and professional. The whole experience was very positive.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: scorecardmj83
title: Exceptional people with exceptional skills
body:
I fell in a park in Dunmurry & broke my wrist. The bone was sticking out. On arrival to A&E, I was greeted by a lovely staff nurse called Megan. On seeing my injury, I was taken straight into department. Consultant Mr Hoey and registrars Allison & Eddie all looked after me. They were amazing.  
Once the fracture was aligned, of which I do not remember anything, I was transferred to ward 5C. I continued antibiotic therapy overnight until I had surgery. The staff who cared for me in 5C where just excellent, and so thorough. I remember a male nursing auxiliary making up an elevation sling & checking I was comfortable. The staff nurse who looked after me was super, and acted as an advocate for me in maintaining my confidentiality.  
Both of them were excellent. After surgery I was moved to ward 4B, where I received exceptional care in the four days I was there. Nurse George was brilliant, as were all the members of staff I came into contact with. I thanked sister Alma for all the great care and attention. They have an amazing team. I am still being followed up by consultant orthopaedic surgeon, Ms Murphy, and all her team at the fracture clinic.  
I am just in" AWE". I have received nothing but the best of care, they are all marvellous. Ms Murphy has referred me for physio, were I am being cared for by Shannon, who has worked incredibly well at obtaining maximum function whilst recovering from this nasty fracture.  
Thank you so much A&E, Ward 5C, Ward 4B, the Fracture Clinic, and Physio Department. You are all amazing, and it just makes me so proud to work in the Royal Victoria Hospital and in the trust, as I am a nurse myself. These individuals are exceptional people with exceptional skills.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: LisaMcA
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Really helpful service which prevented hospital admission
body:
Story by granddaughter of 80+ year old female patient from Derry/Londonderry area  
Good explanation of the service was provided with leaflet given. The girls were very helpful and kept us updated regarding medications. The Occupational Therapist completed a home visit to assess for equipment. Could not fault service or staff. They were really helpful and prevented granny from having to be admitted to hospital by this service being available at home.  
I do not think enough people are aware of this service. Really appreciated the help with which we had from from Acute Care at Home. Thank you very much.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Tippy
title: My experience was one filled with positivity, care and love
body:
I was admitted to Causeway Hospital, Surgical 2, for laparoscopic cholecystectomy, but which ended up having to be done by conventional surgery through no fault of the surgeon.  
From the moment I entered the hospital until my discharge on 29 August, my experience was one filled with positivity, care and love. All the staff were so kind and caring, from medical, nursing, catering and domestics. ( Oh and I really love the food. ) Absolutely nothing was a bother to any of them. I wouldn't be able name them all, but each and every one made the whole experience relaxed and a good experience despite having major surgery.  
I also had occasion to have a gynae op last year, and my experience was exactly the same - caring, loving, relaxed and professional. In August last year I was also admitted with acute cholecystectomy, and again I had the very same experience in the Medical Ward.  
In this day and age I think people are too quick to criticize, and I just felt the need to sing the praises of Causeway Hospital and the wonderful staff, and give them all a real big thank you.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

title: Needs changes
body: I joined this surgery about 6 years ago due to moving house. They lost prescriptions, medication ect and I can't say I've had a good experience since the beginning. I recently fell down the stairs. I did an e-consult and explained the pain I was in as I'd injured my coccyx bone. A doctor didn't even contact me themselves and automatically booked me an appointment to physio. I rang the practice and explained I needed painkillers for the pain and was told if that's what the doctor said then that's what needed to happen. Due to the lack of support, I had to attend a&e. The doctor there agreed I should not have been referred to physio as the back problem was from a fall not a long term issue and that they should have prescribed pain killers. Fast forward 2 weeks, I'm still in pain and I can feel the bone moving. I am quite scared about it as it is my spine. I filled in another e-consult on Sunday 29th August and was told a doctor would be in touch by Wednesday 31st at 6:30pm. I rang the practice at 5:15pm on Wednesday to be told my econsult was still being processed and I wasn't on any list for a telephone appointment. I asked her if she  could speak to a doctor and ask them why my case wasn't looked at yet. She said she couldn't because all doctors had gone home.  Whoever is in charge of this practice needs to review it. Its impossible to get a face to face appointment with your doctor, you need to book a day off work for an appointment as you aren't given a time and they need ro reviiew their e-consult system as its obviously not up to standards. This isn't the first time this has happened to me and I've gone a week before waiting for a doctor to contact me. It's not good enough and this practice is adding to the problem a&e and dealing with.

author: Herbie#61
title: Nothing was too much trouble.
body: Understandably anxious after fast-track referral because of post menopausal bleeding. Super friendly and supportive staff, from the receptionist to the entire medical team. Very clear explanation of what to expect, and what was happening at every step of the procedure. Advice given re time scales for receiving results etc, and clear explanation of post-procedure care. The staff were obviously very busy, but went out of their way to put me at ease as far as possible. Nothing was too much trouble.

author: ESJDC89
title: Staff were friendly and efficient
body:
Delayed procedure for kidney stone due to complications with intubation and pandemic. CT Scan, pre-op and procedure carried out with professionalism and care. Surgical staff kept me informed throughout.  
Needed spinal anaesthetic due to issues with the intubation. However, staff were friendly and efficient, giving me confidence that all would go smoothly.  
Day Unit staff were great and did everything to ensure I got home when a slight complication arose.  
A follow-up procedure is required, and I already have a date for pre-op and procedure at Victoria Hospital.  
Well done, NHS Fife.

author: branbh55
title: Helpful and supportive medical staff
body: I would like to have on record that I feel that the senior medical staff involved in stroke care University Hospital Wishaw are always very supportive of their AHP and nursing colleagues . Dr Forrest and Dr Whitehead are always approachable and open to discussion and multi-disciplinary working and this has a very positive knock on effect regarding patient care.

author: telescopiumbm85
title: Amazing teams in bowel cancer department
body:
A bowel check at my local surgery located blood in my stool. I was referred to RCH Treliske and very soon had an appointment for a colonoscopy and gastroscopy.  
On the day I was understandably anxious , but the staff superbly allayed my fears and were wonderful. The actual procedure was carried out with sensitivity and calmness and I was told what was happening at all times. 2 polyps were removed but they were unable to complete the journey of the camera in my bowel.  
The next step was for a CT scan which located another polyp. The staff here were equally lovely, and fully explained the procedure. Amazing …Within a week from having that , I was offered a short notice cancellation in a few days , instead of anticipated 4-6 weeks later! This was completed successfully yesterday. The staff here are so dedicated in what they do. The teamwork and dedication and long hours that they work , go above and beyondand all is carried out because of their love and caring within them!Saying“ Thankyou “ just doesn’t seem enough .

author: August44
title: Accident and Emergency
body:
I had to take my elderly mother into A&E with chest pain.  
All staff we met from reception, nurses, radiology were very courteous and kind. However, mum’s doctor, Dr Williamson, was excellent. Her personality and mannerisms were over and above in kindness. She was very down to earth, open and honest. She put my mum and myself at ease. She very clearly and precisely explained all tests, why they were completed, and outcomes of each result. Thankfully, mum was OK to be discharged that night.  
Also may I add that the cleaning staff worked continuously to tidy up bottles /papers after patients left the waiting room. They brushed/hoovered numerous times during our wait, and toilets were kept clean despite large volume of public use.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Wee Lucy
title: The staff are awesome
body:
I have to go a couple of times a year for hydrocortisone injections in my relatively young knees which sadly gave up on me long before they really should have. :(:(  
To receive the injections, I attend the Medical Day Case Unit (MDCU) of the Ulster Hospital, Dundonald. On each and every visit for my treatment the staff are awesome, so friendly and welcoming, and that really helps when you are attending for treatments that are not particularly pleasant.  
On my last visit I was greeted at reception and immediately put at my ease by the wonderful staff who welcomed me and had a lovely chat with me before I went to the waiting room to be called in to get my injections.  
The consultant who carried out the injections - yes, I was also lucky enough on this day to have a consultant treat me. Both the consultant and the nurse who was helping him were lovely. They chatted to me and put me very much at my ease throughout. I feel very lucky to have people like this taking care of the ongoing treatment I receive for osteoarthritis of my knees.  
Thank you, MCDU.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

title: excellent service
body: I called into the pharmacy to check out a minor problem , was advised to be seen by the surgery. When phoned the receptionist was extremely helpful and got me a appointment the next day. Nurse practitioner was very good took time to explain what it was and referred me to the hand surgeon . Also explained what do do if symptoms change before I am seen. Thank you all very much

title: Very friendly practice
body: I called in for an appointment in the morning and couldn’t believe the fact I got one. This is extremely rare nowadays. The lovely receptionist spoke in wonderful manor and was very helpful. I was seen on time for my appointment, however then had issues with my medicine. The lady in glasses(didn’t get her name but I think she was the manager) helped me to sort the issue and even went out of her way to help together with another lady in glasses. Thank you so much for everything you do

title: Great practice
body: Appointment with nurse for a jab today and it was a really good experience, on time, quick prep and really great caring nurse. 5 star service

title: Lovely doctor
body: I had a gynaecology appt today. Very little waiting time. The registrar immediately told me his name (this does not always happen) and made me feel completely at ease. He carefully explained everything to me and was very efficient and quick in carrying out a biopsy. Very impressed.

title: Great Practice
body:
My experience was very good with this practice .They listened to my problems carefully and I felt very good and the Dr was also very good . The staff had smiles on their faces .I was also happy to see them .
Thank you

title: Great Practice
body: I had to visit Lime Tree Surgery daily for over a month due to surgery. Both nurses at the surgery were absolutely great. Always had time to listen to any concerns. The doctors are great. I have managed to have face to face appointments when needed.  The receptionists are always very helpful when visiting or phoning the surgery.

title: Extraordinary people!
body:
Since registering with Parishes Bridge over three years ago, I have had many, many interactions with a large number of the team due to my husband’s complex health situation. Everyone I have encountered has been extraordinarily helpful, and they never failed to help us in a professional, compassionate, caring and timely manner. 

They are quite simply amazing. Thank you for all your help.

title: Fantastic staff
body: Excellent reception staff. Extremely efficient and friendly. Very professional,  informative and friendly nurse who put me at ease. ✨️

title: Excellent practice
body:
When we moved we had the the good fortune to live in the post code that led us to Charlton Hill surgery. We have always been treated with staff, medical and admin,in a positive and welcoming way. Over the nine years people have moved on
but the ethos of the surgery has remained the same. Have nothing but praise for this practice.

title: Excellent practice
body: Stayed one night after surgery. Cannot fault a thing. All nurses, doctors, consultant, anesthetist were so friendly and accommodating.

author: David  C
title: Obtaining a heart episode monitor
body:
Booking was easy and efficiently handled. Attended at the allotted time. Seen promptly by a nurse who was very reassuring and explained exactly what was happening. Gave comprehensive instructions and a fitting demonstration.  
No equipment problems during the week I had it, and returned on time as requested. Results awaited.

title: Briliant friendly staff
body:
I had to take my son for an appointment for an ongoing issue.  I felt the dr really listened to what I was saying and consulted with a colleague at derriford  before putting together a few tests/scans to help us.
I always receive an excellent service and help from all the staff across all the beacon centres in Plympton.
Thank you

title: A model of how a practice should work
body:
I had a follow up appointment to investigate my condition after a course of antibiotics.

The doctor was genuinely concerned for my well-being and was methodical and thorough in his diagnosis. He asked all the right questions and actually listened to my answers. This was by far the best GP I have encountered, I could not thank him enough.
The screening process to get me an emergency appointment worked seamlessly, receptionist was professional in her approach.
Overall an excellent experience and a model for patient care as far as I am concerned.

author: songthrushed47
title: The nurse was so kind and reassuring
body: I went to have my implant and the nurse was so kind and reassuring. It made the experience an actually pleasant one rather than the awkward encounter I imagined. It hurt when I had the anaesthetic but it was over very quickly and I was on my way with all of my questions answered.

title: Good communication
body:
The Doctor rang before the visit to ask about details that they should know about the person's background.
After the visit rang to confirm what they had done and arranged further visits .

title: Great practice
body: I am not able to visit practice at present but have had 2 home visits recently and my prescription was ready to collect before the pharmacy closed. Excellent service

title: Caring practice
body: I have been with New Croft Surgery for many years and due to a recent house move have now had to change doctors. During my time with New Croft I have been impressed with how caring and supportive everyone has been. I have had a number of appointments this year and all the doctors have been very understanding and efficient with referrals to hospital for scans. No question was a silly question and I felt valued. Receptionists also friendly and caring in what is a very busy time for them. I will miss being a part of this surgery. Thanks

title: Very swift and honest secretary
body:
I’ve not had the greatest of experiences at this surgery over my time of being a patient here for 25+ years. However, I feel as though over time the management alongside their amazing secretary are working towards where an ideal surgery would be regarded. 

The medical practice is convenient for the surrounding areas and provides ample services for an individuals needs. I have experienced and felt improvements recently which led me to write this somewhat positive review. I feel like the fact the important individuals have realised where we were lacking as a surgery is a giant leap towards making the best of what the NHS can offer in this area!.

P.s we have the best doctors secretary in Nottingham

title: Thorough examination
body: I received a prompt exam after a telephone appointment on the same day identified issues that needed an inspection in person.  The Doctor explained everything well and was very helpful.

title: Saw a great doctor
body:
I've been having stomach issues for awhile due to a hiatus hernia.
I visited a doctor at the surgery that I hadn't seen before and they were extremely good!
They took the time to explain my issue and how it could cause my symptoms, went through my medications and found that there was one that may be causing issues and prescribed me some different medication.
It's good to know there are still some really good doctors around, thank you!

title: Exemplary
body: The care received from this surgery for my elderly father has been wonderful.  The admin staff have been efficient and the doctors nothing but caring.  Can not fault them, highly appreciated.

title: Super helpful doctors... If you can get an…
body:
Availability of appointments is a constant challenge, but once you do eventually get an appointment (oft a phone appointment), the doctors make ample time for you to make a reliable diagnosis, and the interaction never feels rushed. 

Finally, doctors are prepared ahead of appointments, so they're already largely up to speed on your current, or recent past treatments. So this makes for an efficient encounter, without you needing to revisit history each and every time.

author: LAS700
title: The support and care I received was outstanding
body:
I had to attend Day Surgery Unit today to have a procedure carried out under general anaesthetic. The support and care I received was outstanding and could not have asked for any more to be done. I was checked in on regularly, given reassurance when having a wobble, and ensured I had everything I needed. The girls kept me and my family fully up to date with what was happening.  
Joanne, Nicola and Megan were superstars and took fantastic care of me. It just so happened it was my birthday when I was in and they all wished me a Happy Birthday and tried to make things special for me.  
I would like to thank the full team involved from start to finish with my care today for their compassion, upbeat manner and caring nature. It made a bad situation so much easier for me

title: Great practice
body: Professional and excellent DRs as well as the staff very kind and welcoming the dr do there best to provide help needed I have tried other gp not good as this gp simply they are excellent providers.

author: falconwk56
title: Great experience
body: I was treated in an efficient and professional manner and got back to work in a relatively short time.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

title: Being looked after
body: I always feel my healthcare needs are being looked after and that I’m being listened too. All the staff are great from Drs to Reception and it’s a lovely bright clean & calm environment.

title: Wonderful caring, compassionate practice.
body: The practice doctors and staff have been very supportive, caring and helpful whilst looking after my late mother.  I lived away from her and when I had to call for help with her medical care nothing was too much trouble, if they weren’t sure they would find out and come back to me.  The doctors would come and visit her in her home and were alway kind, considerate and made sure to maintain her dignity.  They alway kept me informed about what was going on.  I couldn’t have asked for better care for her.  Thank you.

title: Ear wax removal
body: Fantastic nurse that removed ear wax. Very reassuring, thorough and put me at ease with my anxiety. Also appointment was on time.

author: Mme
title: Everything ran very smoothly
body: From the reception, to all the nurses, and the doctor that I saw on my visit, they could not have been nicer and put you at ease. Everything ran very smoothly, staff were helpful, friendly and made sure you didn't want for anything. Everything was very clean and tidy, with Covid awareness. Thank you one and all.

author: Chalkie
title: Failure to provide medical treatments
body:
I start by acknowledging that the previous service provided to me by the consultants and the nursing staff and support staff has been excellent. This is not part of my complaint which relates to failure by NHS Lanarkshire to provide me with treatment based upon the past two visits in June 2022 and August 2022. I still don’t have the outcome of my blood levels today.  
My complaint relates to the past two visits to receive treatments in Haematology. I attended the last appointment in June to have my bloods checked. The procedure is to check bloods and depending upon the outcome see if I require a venesection. In June the nurse stated my levels were good, I didn’t need a venesection and I would be sent a new appointment in the post.Time passed and I contacted the day unit to say I should be due a return visit. They said I had missed an appointment in early August. They spoke with the nurse in charge and I was given an appointment for yesterday at 3:30pm. I can confirm I do not miss or fail to turn up to my appointments.I arrived at 3.20pm. The nurse who greeted me said that my bloods were good and they just required checking today. I asked how they knew this as my bloods were last checked today in June. They advised that once my bloods were checked I would be advised on levels. I explained that I wait for the results and then if required a venesection is carried out. They said that this is not what they has been advised to do. At my request they clarified this with the consultant and asked that I return to the waiting area. They then returned to say come in and we will get started. I had suggested based upon how I was feeling and the time of day that bloods be taken and venesection started After about 5 minutes and before the blood was removed the charge nurse approached and said they had bad news. They advised that as I had not had my bloods checked since June and based upon the time of day it would be unsafe to carry out this procedure. I asked for an explanation as the timescales between my visits have been longer in the past and the procedure has been carried out. I advised that the risk for me is not doing the treatment as it was last carried out in June. It seems clear that the ability to carry out the treatment was due to the fact that blood taken at 3:39pm may not return before the unit closes at 4:30pm. I stated that if bloods are returned in 20 minutes there is still enough time for venesections to be carried out and I failed to recognise any risk to me. I have had venesection and treatments in the same clinic before. They advised it was a decision made by a senior nurse, which I strongly disagreed with. Why would you bring me into an appointment at 3:30pm if you are not able to provide the necessary care and treatment?  
I normally make my complaint to the managers at University Hospital in Wishaw however their priority appears to be discharge and targets and not ensuring I access the treatment I require .  
The health professional that saw me in June did not confirm my blood levels but on checking yesterday they were at the recommended level to carry out a venesection. They also failed to ensure my appointment was made, placing me at risk. This is not acceptable nor is it appropriate for me to take two days from work when the treatment can be carried out in one visit, even if this requires me to attend both morning and afternoon clinics.

author: barnbloo
title: Accessing primary care
body:
Cannot get appointment in under 2 weeks, but miraculously on complaining one appears. If you call before 8 am similarly. I ask why can't the surgery embrace the internet. That's not the real problem though, it's that no one seems to care. And they wonder why people end up going to A&E instead.  
They say it's the fault of COVID. How exactly does seeing less people block appointments? I hear similar elsewhere so changing surgeries is not a solution.

author: JRose
title: Dermatology Treliske Truro
body: Very quiet department but felt very welcomed. Had the procedure explained by very kind nurse who was very thorough and courteous. I was put at my ease and was in and out very promptly. I had even spoken to the actual nurse on the phone when I rang up to say traffic was going to delay me. On leaving she even had time and courtesy to show me a way out which was quicker!! I’m into the 3rd week of light therapy now at Bodmin Hospital and so far everyone has been professional and friendly at the same time, even when having to tell me to remove my face mask under visor inside the light booth!! Thank you!!

title: Unbelievable care and compassion
body: This surgery is by far the best I’ve been registered with in my lifetime. I’ve had to attend for a long term health issue that’s recently worsened and everyone from the receptionists to the doctors have been amazing. Very friendly and professional. Im so glad I’m on the path to getting answers that I need and it’s all because of the fast thinking GPs. I will forever be grateful for the care I have received this far. Thank you!

title: Very good practice
body: I have received excellent care from the doctors, nurses and also the receptionists who are kind and so helpful .

author: #PMBmouse65
title: I’m very grateful to the doctor and all the staff
body:
I attended the Women’s Health Unit at University Hospital/Wishaw General, Lanarkshire today for diagnostic tests re post menopausal bleeding.  
Outwith my fears about the actual causes of the PMB, I was feeling pretty anxious beforehand about the actual testing process itself, but the treatment and care provided by Dr Pandravada and the nursing staff was excellent throughout.After an initial consultation, I had an internal ultrasound scan, a hysteroscopy and a biopsy done. Everything was explained to me beforehand and I was kept informed and included in dialogue during the tests themselves. My questions were answered patiently and considerately. The initial findings of the tests were explained to me as was the need for a return visit for further treatment.I have been lucky so far in my life to have very rarely required hospital treatment but now that I do, I feel more reassured by the experience I had today for whatever lies ahead. It will be a nervous wait for the biopsy results now for me but I’m very grateful to the doctor and all the staff in the unit for helping me get through my first appointment today.

title: Exceptional service
body: There are no words to express my gratitude for today's visit. The receptionist was thoughtful enough to mention I was seeing a female Dr (intimate issue), and my patient and empathetic Doctor saw me within 5 hours of my appointment request and solved my issue and anxiety. This is how every surgery should be...

title: Amazing
body: Had a smear appointment, I arrived early but they brought me straight in. Nurse explained everything to me and made me feel comfortable

author: BestCare4MyBoy
title: My son being so unwell
body:
My son got admitted to hospital in Boston. It was by far one of the worst times of my life. He was so poorly and struggling to breathe. I have had every single nurse and doctor on ward 4A care for my son and honestly every single one of them was by far the best I have ever come across. They are so genuine and cared so much for my son.  
It was a long 9 days but the staff made it so much of a breeze, they were so friendly and welcoming which was what I really needed. During this time my family had to go back home so being away not knowing anyone at a scary time like this, honestly I can’t thank you all enough for everything you have done. You really did all you could to get him back to himself  
Thankyou

author: Nonna01
title: I have been given hope for the future
body:
I have lived with diabetes for the last 17 years and have continually denied my diagnosis and have stumbled through the regime of dealing with my diabetes. I have had good support from the diabetic nurse from my GP surgery, but have never felt hopeful or sure of my future in dealing with the diabetes.  
However, I have now been referred to the Community Specialist Diabetic Team in my local hospital and have received very quick, helpful and supportive service, for which I am very grateful.  
The session was very informative, delivered in a sensitive manner and professional.  
I have been given hope for the future and feel my concerns have been listened to.

title: Extremely reliable, accessible and friendly.
body: Since moving from our previous GP from another borough several years ago (where we had an awful experience) we have been consistently very pleased with our experience at St James Practice. We wanted to say a huge thank you to our GP and all the admin team for doing a fantastic job throughout the pandemic and beyond.  You've always been extremely friendly and helpful and have responded quickly and efficiently to our health care needs as a family at some challenging and scary times over the years. Looking at the headlines we know that we are lucky to have had this experience from our local practice. So thank you, I hope this goes a little way to let you know it's worth the effort.

title: Brilliant Medical Practice
body: I’ve been with the practice for over a year now. I’ve had a wonderful and warm experience from start to finish. All staff are happy to help from front line to back office. They always apologise for the wait when they answer the phones but I can’t say I’ve ever waited that long for an answer it’s the only surgery in the village so waiting is to be expected. I appreciate my Dr. taking time to go over my recent and previous medical history in our first consultation. I would Highly recommended this surgery five stars.

author: Ceegee
title: Fantastic antenatal care
body:
I'm 7 months pregnant and had reduced movements at the end of August 2022. I was asked to come into maternity triage at Royal Alexandria hospital in Paisley for assessment. I was seen promptly by midwife on duty Gillian who was so kind and reassuring during this worrying time. I wanted to write in and say thank you to Gillian for being so lovely and patient with me when I was anxious about being admitted overnight for additional monitoring.  
Gillian was actually the midwife on duty when I went in for assessment in 2020 to have my son. Again I was having a terrible time of things thanks to a back to back labour and my anxiety was at an all time high as this was during COVID. I was so stressed my baby was getting distressed and my waters broke in triage with meconium which made the situation even more scary. Gillian was fantastic and could not have looked after me any better. My husband and I were both hugely comforted by her professionalism and competence. Thank you so much Gillian, you are my personal super star ❤️

title: Wonderful doctor!
body: Excellent communication, always clear and prompt correspondence on progress regarding results and treatment. Feels like we are listened to and never rushing us.

title: Nice people
body: I have just gone to this new place and I think it is very nice and the people seem very friendly. I am having a baby and they are looking after me as I will be a single parent I have a friend who got Mental Health problems after the birth of her son and there was little help for her 30 years ago except pills but this surgery has a Mental Health Nurse who can support me in other ways so I am reassured by that. This seems like a positive move.

author: IamTrulyGrateful
title: Excellent patient care and professionalism
body: I was recently admitted to ward 3B at Crosshouse Hospital in Kilmarnock for a pleural effusion secondary to a cancer diagnosis. I was an inpatient for just shy of two weeks and the care, diligence and attention I received from every single member of medical, nursing and ancillary staff during that time was outstanding. I just wanted to pass on my heartfelt thanks to everyone who looked after me and express my sincere gratitude for the genuine care and professionalism I received during such a scary and vulnerable time in my life. Thank you. x

author: 11Patient
title: Well cared for at the breast clinic
body:
I was seen at the Breast Clinic, and I just wanted to thank everyone very much at the clinic for being thoughtful and caring. Ashley, Anna and Elaine in radiology were all lovely to me and looked after me so well. Dr Todd was so kind to me, taking time to answer my questions and reassure me.  
I’ve been to the breast clinic a number of times previously and I always appreciate that the team take the time to care. I am treated with respect and compassion, knowing I’ll be in safe hands takes a lot of stress out of a worrying situation. Thank you!

title: Helpful, proficient staff
body: Had to attend for suspected celulitis (I have lymphoedema) when I was on holiday in the area. I was dealt with well and sympathetically: tests, examine and, finally, penicillin. It took a while but you expect that when we can walk up at any time and there was a steady flow of people being seen to, of all ages and severity. Thank you!

author: Euansmammy73
title: Nothing was a problem for all the wonderful staff
body:
Attended for day surgery to have my gallbladder removed. From the nurses, the OPD, the anaesthetist to my surgeon I was made to feel at ease the moment I arrived in the department.  
As a nurse myself, I understand the stresses and strains that the NHS is undergoing at present. However, nothing was a problem for all the wonderful staff.  
I was transferred to Ward A post op, where again I was treated with dignity and respect at all times. I was discharged that evening and now resting and recovering at home.  
I wish to thank everyone for their patience and professionalism, as I was very nervous about the procedure. However, looking back I know that I had nothing to be worried about.

author: Auchlea
title: Appalling GP service
body:
I woke with chest pain and tightness. I called the GP 9 times to get through and eventually got an appointment at midday.  
I was made to wait outside the building, away from main door round the back of the building at a fire exit, for 45 minutes before being allowed entry, despite having a negative lateral flow test prior to attending. Also asked to give personal information via the intercom in full hearing of other patients.  
I was diagnosed with Hayfever. The symptoms returned later that night and I was eventually "blue lighted" to hospital suffering a heart attack.I spent a week in hospital and had two stents inserted.  
Following discharge I attended the surgery to arrange medications and was again made to give information via an intercom in front of other patients. I was never allowed to access the building.  
When I received my medications from the pharmacy I noted they were wrong when compared with my discharge medication.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership
St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: saturncd89
title: A credit to the nursing profession
body:
At the end of August 2022 I was admitted to the Day Surgery Unit, F.V.R.H Larbert for surgery on my knee. I was made very welcome by staff Nurse Julie who was responsible for my care before and after surgery.  
Julie along with staff nurse Nicola and auxiliary nurse Arlene were thoroughly professional, kind and made me feel at ease prior to surgery. On return from surgery I became unwell. The care and attention I received from Julie, Arlene and Nicola was exemplary. I cannot thank them enough for for their kindness, care and professionalism during my stay in the day surgery unit.  
All of these nursing staff are extremely committed and are a credit to the nursing profession.  
[Unsure about 'Staff skills']  
  
[Unsure about 'Staff attitude']  
  
[Unsure about 'Team work']  
  
[Unsure about 'Treatment']

author: Paisley Patient
title: Positive experience at RAH Dermatology Outpatient
body:
After decades of suffering and countless GP trips about the same problem over the same time period, I was finally referred to Dermatology after discussing this at a routine rheumatology appointment. First of all, I'd like to say I'm so grateful to Rheumatology (I can't for the life of me remember the doctor who was kind enough to do this for me, was a female under Dr Baxter's clinic) for being good enough to make a referral that my GP should probably have made decades ago. I really am so grateful.  
Anyway, my appointment for Dermatology finally came round, and to say I was anxious is putting it mildly. Not only was I embarrassed to discuss my skin problems, I was worried that it would be a wasted appointment because I really had just about lost all hope of anyone ever being able to help me.  
Enter Dr Stafford, who was working on Dr Burfield's clinic. Not only did she apologise for the long wait for my appointment (which let's face it, given the recent problems with the NHS, was hardly within their control) she was so kind and had the loveliest manner which served to immediately put me at ease. She made what was a very daunting appointment much less so just by her kind and patient nature.  
She took the time to listen to my 'moans' and I came away with renewed hope that a chronic problem (though possibly not curable and certainly not instantly so) could finally possibly be eased and with a clear and concise plan for potential future management and what the next steps would be in my treatment. I really hope I have her name right, I asked on the way out of the appointment but with a brain like a sieve, it had practically instantly left my mind.  
I know this may seem like a potentially trivial appointment/experience to feedback on, but I can't express how relieved I feel to finally have a bit of hope for something which has affected my life in such a massive way for so long! I feel everyone is always so quick to knock the services when they don't quite meet the standards expected, but never so quick to pass on credit where it's due! I really hope Dr Stafford gets the recognition she deserves for a job well done and that she gets to hear how truly grateful I am! :-)

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: listenyx39
title: Huge thank you
body:
I would like to extend my gratitude to Andy, an advanced clinical practitioner at Lewisham Hospital. Andy assessed my grandad who had difficulty in breathing a few weeks ago. Andy’s name still comes up in conversation today. We are extremely grateful for his kindness, thorough approach, insight and advice. Andy is one of the few clinicians that really acknowledged our concerns and invested them. He demonstrated great professionalism and knowledge, in fact his suggestion were on point (home nebuliser and an overnight admission).  
Once again, a huge thank you.

author: falconwt73
title: The support we received was outstanding
body:
My beautiful wee mum spent her remaining 5 days in Kilbryde hospice. We honestly couldn't have asked for a nicer warmer and beautiful environment for my mum to pass over. Every staff member involved in my mum's care are amazing the emotional and mental support my family received was outstanding.  
Her hair was combed every morning, her face was washed and she was kept as comfortable as possible 24/7. Those 5 days were the hardest for my family and we couldn't have got through without the overwhelming support from all staff members can't thank each one of them enough. My mum passed away at 02:20 am and when we saw her she was so beautiful. As a thank you for everything we have a donation box in my mum's memory will continue whenever possible to help with donation support and fundraising. ❤️  
[Happy with 'Environment']  
  
[Unsure about 'Cleanliness']  
  
[Unsure about 'Room']

author: July 4th
title: My health
body: I became quite poorly and was coughing and short of breath. I was told I had mild COPD, so I decided I needed to take better care of myself, health wise. It's probably a bit too late, but I have to try, and giving up smoking was my first step. I have been a smoker for nearly 60 years.

author: Nickg58
title: Professional and knowledgeable care
body:
I went for pre-op assessment at the end of August 2022. I was seen by one registered nurse, one student nurse and a second RN joined us for further examination.  
If the nursing care I receive post-op is as professional, knowledgeable, informative and friendly as at pre-op, I will consider myself to be in very safe hands and with nothing to worry about.

title: Day surgery unit
body:
After 14 long hours in A&E with my daughter we was admitted on to the day surgery ward, as the hospital was so busy! 
My daughter whom is 16 and suffers with very severe had to stay in hospital for 5 days. 
I want to say a massive thank you to all the staff that supported her your all amazing! 
I’m so grateful

readBy.name: Milton Keynes University Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: orionj77
title: Good care at Ayr University Hospital
body: Diagnosed with cancer. Well looked after in Ayr Hospital by the great team on Station 9. Special mentions to nurses Tammy, Marion, Colin and Fiona. Thanks to Dr. Emma for expediting the next step as well. Most especially thank you to Dr. Gillen: it is so good when competence is married with caring beyond the call of duty. I do hope you eventually managed some lunch!

readBy.name: Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)

author: hydrusxz37
title: Long wait in a&e
body:
Sat in a&e with 12 year old child who had large slash to hand with excessive bleeding. It was quite busy however people came and went. After 2.5 hours a child who was bleeding had still not been seen, with nobody checking on him to ensure he wasn’t in shock of becoming faint. Instead staff stood at the triage rooms chatting which can be seen from the waiting area.  
The priority/triage service needs to be improved. So much for the 4 hour time frame. We are still waiting!

author: Mump
title: Further advice
body: Called re further advice for son with DCD who needs help in education
